ART CS 5.title: Group Studies
ART CS 5.description: Student-directed discussion and study in a variety of subjects within Art.

ART CS 15.title: Art Colloquium
ART CS 15.comments: May be taken as often as once each quarter.
ART CS 15.description: Students receiving credit will present talks in their field on material arranged in consultation with the instructor. Credit assigned by the instructor will reflect the extent and quality of participation.

ART CS 101.title: Drawing and Painting
ART CS 101.description: Emphasis on the practice and development of making paintings and drawings.

ART CS 102.title: Themes
ART CS 102.comments: May be taken as often as once each quarter.
ART CS 102.description: Drawing and painting in sequences, and according to themes.

ART CS 104.title: Prints
ART CS 104.description: Emphasis on letterpress printing using metal and wooden type; typography; various relief print methods and materials utilized will be determined by particular faculty interest.

ART CS 105.title: Book Arts
ART CS 105.description: The study and practice of the book arts; artists' books; typography; letterpress printing; both traditional and experimental uses of the printing press.

ART CS 106.title: Art Symposium
ART CS 106.description: A continuing series of lectures and presentations by artists and professionals closely associated with the arts.

ART CS 107.title: History, Theory, and Criticism
ART CS 107.description: Non-studio emphasis on historical, theoretical, and contemporary ideas and issues. A range of concepts will be discussed, from various approaches,according to the particular interests of faculty and students.

ART CS 112.title: Special Topics
ART CS 112.description: This special studies course allows faculty to design and execute courses that reflect their particular research and teaching.

ART CS 120.title: Sculpture
ART CS 120.description: Practice in the design and development of making a sculpture using various materials as determined by particular faculty interest.

ART CS 125.title: Sculpture-Related Studies
ART CS 125.description: Non-studio emphasis on generation and development of images, ideas, and imagination through field trips, slides, presentations, and videos. Primarily for sculptors.

ART CS 150.title: Elements of Filmmaking/Video
ART CS 150.description: Practice in theory and technique of filmmaking or video. Students will learn to use the basic equipment, and will make films or videos both individually and in collaboration. Medium utilized will be determined by particular faculty interest.

ART CS 199.title: Independent Studies
ART CS 199.comments: Creative Studies students may enroll in a maximum of 24 units of Independent Studies courses per year, with a total of 45 units counted toward graduation.
ART CS 199.description: Serious independent study in art with consenting faculty member.
